Hi, @wayilau 
You need to add your `clustrer-etcd-plugin` artifact in `server-starter`'s maven dependencies. Otherwise, program can not start up with `ProviderNotFoundException: cluster module no provider exists.` exception. Follow https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-starter/pom.xml#L73. And after finish this, you can test it in you local env.
Please make sure this could work before you ask for pull request review.

> Hi, @wayilau
> You need to add your `clustrer-etcd-plugin` artifact in `server-starter`'s maven dependencies. Otherwise, program can not start up with `ProviderNotFoundException: cluster module no provider exists.` exception. Follow https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-starter/pom.xml#L73. And after finish this, you can test it in you local env.


> Please make sure this could work before you ask for pull request review.

OK, i will add.

> Please make sure this could work before you ask for pull request review.

ok, i will test this first.
Please follow the suggestion. We have provided a better way.


@wu-sheng @JaredTan95  
I have add the etcd testcases follow the library-client does.
Read the document carefully. You changed the `application.yml` incorrectly.

> Read the document carefully. You changed the `application.yml` incorrectly.

i just config the yml storage nodes

storage:
elasticsearch:
clusterName: CollectorDBCluster

elk.yml config is
cluster.name: CollectorDBCluster

run skywalking startup.bat

error is :

2019-05-27 14:57:14,074 - org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.starter.OAPServerStartUp - 55 [main] ERROR [] - null
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.client.elasticsearch.ElasticSearchClient.parseClusterNodes(ElasticSearchClient.java:91) ~[library-client-6.1.0.jar:6.1.0]
at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.client.elasticsearch.ElasticSearchClient.connect(ElasticSearchClient.java:70) ~[library-client-6.1.0.jar:6.1.0]
at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.storage.plugin.elasticsearch.StorageModuleElasticsearchProvider.start(StorageModuleElasticsearchProvider.java:129) ~[storage-elasticsearch-plugin-6.1.0.jar:6.1.0]
at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.module.BootstrapFlow.start(BootstrapFlow.java:57) ~[library-module-6.1.0.jar:6.1.0]
at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.module.ModuleManager.init(ModuleManager.java:65) ~[library-module-6.1.0.jar:6.1.0]
at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.starter.OAPServerStartUp.main(OAPServerStartUp.java:43) [server-starter-6.1.0.jar:6.1.0]
This is just caused by your OAP doesn't start up right.
Please read the document, we have indicated how to set up ElasticSearch as storage. Also, the document has guided you about how to do a quick start.

> This is just caused by your OAP doesn't start up right.

Hi!
I checked the oap container through docker logs -f -t --tail 100 skywalking-oap, the operation has been normal, no exception!
My development environment is deployed in the same way, there is no such problem!
The docker-compose content is as follows:

``` dockerfile
  skywalking-oap:
    image: registry.cn-shenzhen.aliyuncs.com/zengql-release/skywalking-oap:6.1.0
    container_name: skywalking-oap
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 11800:11800
      - 12800:12800
    environment:
      - SW_CLUSTER_ZK_HOST_PORT=${Host}:2181
      - SW_CLUSTER_CONSUL_HOST_PORT=${Host}:8500
      - SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES=${Host}:9200
      - SW_ES_USER=elastic
      - SW_ES_PASSWORD=Za888888
    volumes:
      - ${Workdir}/skywalking/config:/skywalking/config:ro

  skywalking-ui:
    image: registry.cn-shenzhen.aliyuncs.com/zengql-release/skywalking-ui:6.1.0
    container_name: skywalking-ui
    depends_on:
      - skywalking-oap
    links:
      - skywalking-oap
    restart: always
    ports:
      - 18080:8080
    environment:
      collector.ribbon.listOfServers: skywalking-oap:12800
```

Similarly, it is normal to view the information via the command line: `docker exec skywalking-ui ping skywalking-oap`.

I can't tell what happens in your env. But I noticed two things
1. Your set both ZK and Consul, I don't know why.
1. Your Zuul log says timeout, then means your UI can't connect to OAP server.

From my perspective, you haven't understood how OAP works. Please read the document, try quick start and advanced features, rather than simply use a docker image to start.
We are running OAP in k8s for long time, I am sure whether some configs are being misunderstood or something else.

> I can't tell what happens in your env. But I noticed two things
> 
> 1. Your set both ZK and Consul, I don't know why.
> 2. Your Zuul log says timeout, then means your UI can't connect to OAP server.
> 
> From my perspective, you haven't understood how OAP works. Please read the document, try quick start and advanced features, rather than simply use a docker image to start.
> We are running OAP in k8s for long time, I am sure whether some configs are being misunderstood or something else.

Sorry, although the configuration is consul, `application.yml` is not enabled!
Only zookeeper clusters are available.
Therefore, due to the same deployment method of the development environment, it is normal to run for a long time, and the problem just mentioned is accidental. I hope that you can help, give some reasons for guessing, thank you!

**At the same time, I will go to the official deployment documentation.**

I looked at the existing test cases, and the test image is based on mongodb 3.4.
It may take a lot of work to add testing for mongodb 3.0 ~ 3.2.
Is there an easier way ?

> I looked at the existing test cases, and the test image is based on mongodb 3.4.
It may take a lot of work to add testing for mongodb 3.0 ~ 3.2.
Is there an easier way ?

You mean, Mongodb 3.0~3.2 client can't connect the server?

> I am still not sure the result of this plugin, could you provide
> 
> 1. Topology and trace when xxl server and xxl client under SkyWalking monitoring
> 2. Topology and trace when only xxl client under SkyWalking monitoring

1Sorrythe xxl-job server call client with JettyHttpClient and the new version remove itand the skywalking not support jetty plugin.
2If the xxl server not under the SkyWalking monitoring ContextManager.capture() may be NullPointerException
I haven't tested it yet. I'm just worried about it. :worried:

> 2If the xxl server not under the SkyWalking monitoring ContextManager.capture() may be NullPointerException

This is not the factor. I think you misunderstand the API usage.
I think MongoDB should have official images for different versions. You could use them in another test cases.
These are standard steps for new plugins. And this is the only way we could check the plugin really works.

According to document of  [skywalking-ui](https://hub.docker.com/r/apache/skywalking-ui <https://hub.docker.com/r/apache/skywalking-ui>), the environment variable of oap address is `SW_OAP_ADDRESS` instead of `collector.ribbon.listOfServers`

Hongtao Gao

Apache SkyWalking && Apache ShardingSphere
Twitter, @hanahmily

We are instrumenting the RPC frameworks and libs. Spring boot has nothing related to our interests. We just make sure we don't conflict with Spring framework.

Plugin contribution is welcome.

@lclin412 Please read my reply again, this error `java.lang.RuntimeException: IDs can't be null` is nothing serious, just UI still query when parameter doesn't exist. Nothing harmful to OAP server.

Restart right now, I only know reason related is ElasticSearch too slow for your env. I don't know how you are using it, but in most cases and my case, it could support billions of tps in prod.
@wu-sheng I didn't know before
@Arugal I guessed so. That is why I wrote one and tested by myself. Google the Java jmh benchmark. You could do this easily.
Cloud you post me that error message?

Look at source code,v6.1 is ok,it has been repaired.
English Only. And we are welcome contributions. We don't do all plugin by ourselves.
Duplicate of #2709
We don't manipulate `OAuth2` from I known. We just enhance `AopProxyFactoryInstrumentation` itself.

Could you submit a pull request to fix it? And remove 
```
        <shade.org.apache.http.source>org.apache.http</shade.org.apache.http.source>
        <shade.org.apache.http.target>${shade.package}.${shade.org.apache.http.source}</shade.org.apache.http.target>
```
We don't depend on `org.apache.http` today.

> We don't manipulate `OAuth2` from I known. We just enhance `AopProxyFactoryInstrumentation` itself.

I think it is oauth2 serialized a DefaultAopProxyFactory instance into session. Does SkyWalking enhance DefaultAopProxyFactory? Could enhancement cause different serializationUID on different nodes?
FYI In Spring source code, DefaultAopProxyFactory is serializable and has no serializationUID.

FYI, I found private static final String ENHANCE_CLASS = "org.springframework.aop.framework.DefaultAopProxyFactory" in org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.spring.patch.define.AopProxyFactoryInstrumentation.
Does that mean SkyWalking enhances DefaultAopProxyFactory?
Since DefaultAopProxyFactory is serializable and has not specified serializationUID, could SkyWalking agent do something to avoid this serial/deserialization exception?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23638678/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23638678)

Coverage remained the same at 16.861% when pulling **7f9260f2936c2bf581920389e9dcf9423db734f1 on sk163:fix-agent-shade-plugin-bug** into **bfd46151ad63ffda50272d2a3eb2b8cd3bb618a5 on apache:master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23639833/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23639833)

Coverage increased (+0.002%) to 16.863% when pulling **2ebd11fcf9f4616c05f69aa33284c0d97dbdc629 on sk163:fix-agent-shade-plugin-bug** into **bfd46151ad63ffda50272d2a3eb2b8cd3bb618a5 on apache:master**.
That is not your bean. It is Spring intetnal factory. I don't think you really use that.

I don't use that directly, but I use spring oauth2 and I believe that spring oauth2 stores DefaultAopProxyFactory in session store.
FYI, I look into the binary bytes that serialized in the session store with attribute named 'scopedTarget.oauth2ClientContext'.  It show:

org.springframework.aop.framework.DefaultAopProxyFactory?TP^B ^AL ^W_$EnhancedClassField_wsq

I think this proves that an instance of DefaultAopProxyFactory is enhanced by Skywalking and serialized into session store by spring oauth2 and spring session.
Yes, I can confirm we enhanced the `DefaultAopProxyFactory`, but why do you save this `DefaultAopProxyFactory` into the session?

I do not. 
I use Spring Oauth2 and I think it saves DefaultAopProxyFactory into the session. 
I will raise an issue in spring-security-oauth repository to get confirmation.

But since DefaultAopProxyFactory implements Serializable interface, I think potentially it could be serialized. If SkyWalking agent enhancement changes the serializationUID of the class, then InvalidClassException could happen when deserialized on another jvm.

> But since DefaultAopProxyFactory implements Serializable interface, I think potentially it could be serialized. If SkyWalking agent enhancement changes the serializationUID of the class, then InvalidClassException could happen when deserialized on another jvm.

SkyWalking just add a new field and new interface with two methods(set/get). But Byte Buddy may add a static field if I remember right. Would that harm?

> LGTM

also remove apm-agent maven pom file,shade-plugin excludes:

<exclude>org.apache.httpcomponents:*</exclude>
<exclude>commons-logging:*</exclude>
<exclude>commons-codec:*</exclude>

I think that any changes on java class structure would changed calculated serializationUID of that class.

IMHO if the added methods/interface/fields are with different name on different jvm, it could cause different serializationUID and cause exception when serialize/deserialize on different jvm.

On the other hand, I also feel that it is wierd that Spring OAuth stores DefaultAopProxyFactory into the session.

FYI

https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security-oauth/issues/1684
Also, is it possible for SkyWalking to add static serialize UID that consistent to the original class when enhance serializable classes?
Fixed.

> Also, is it possible for SkyWalking to add static serialize UID that consistent to the original class when enhance serializable classes?

We don't do that, because it meaningless for us, and could cause more issue. Also from my experience, this ID should not require updated even SkyWalking change the class structure.

Never mind. Kubernetes API always set it to a non-null value.

Hongtao Gao

Apache SkyWalking && Apache ShardingSphere
Twitter, @hanahmily

First of all, all things need to be English, including snapshot. Then if you are talking about performance, then learn from #2766 . We need proof of performance improvement. Do benchmark if this really makes sense.
You need to consider the execution times in real scenario. From my understanding, this is only related to startup and invoke limited times.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23641041/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23641041)

Coverage decreased (-0.006%) to 16.859% when pulling **06948555d53ed21836bf81ff5a72d8de6aaa2ba5 on patch/als** into **bcdf1c4bd500c574e29a60ce7d2d76a8659a55b5 on master**.
